Eggnog Latte

Jump to Recipe

Indulge in the cozy flavors of the holiday season with our delightful Eggnog Latte recipe. This creamy, rich beverage combines the festive taste of traditional eggnog with a robust shot of espresso, creating the perfect winter warmer. Whether you're cozying up by the fireplace or hosting a holiday gathering, this Eggnog Latte is sure to impress your family and friends. With just a few simple ingredients like eggnog, milk, and nutmeg, you can whip up this delicious drink in no time. Let’s dive into how you can create this creamy delight that captures the essence of the holidays, one sip at a time!

Ingredients

eggnog

Choose store-bought or homemade eggnog. If you're making it from scratch, consider adding a splash of rum or bourbon for an extra festive kick. For a non-dairy option, use almond milk or coconut milk blended with a bit of vanilla extract and cinnamon.

espresso or strong coffee

If you don't have an espresso machine, brew a strong cup of coffee using a French press or a pour-over method. For a caffeine-free version, try using decaf coffee or a coffee substitute like roasted chicory.

milk

You can use any type of milk including whole, skim, or non-dairy alternatives like oat milk or almond milk. If you want a creamier texture, consider using half-and-half or heavy cream. Frothing the milk before adding it enhances the latte experience.

ground nutmeg

Freshly grated nutmeg offers a more intense flavor than pre-ground. If you don't have nutmeg, you can substitute with ground cinnamon or a spice blend called 'pumpkin pie spice' for a different twist.

whipped cream (optional)

For a richer experience, consider making your own whipped cream using heavy cream and a bit of sugar and vanilla extract. For a dairy-free alternative, use coconut whipped cream or a store-bought vegan whipped topping.

Cooking Steps

  • Step 1: Brew Espresso or Strong Coffee

    Start by brewing a shot of espresso or a strong cup of coffee. Use freshly ground coffee beans for the best flavor, and ensure your coffee maker is clean to avoid any old tastes.

  • Step 2: Heat Eggnog and Milk

    In a small saucepan, combine 1 cup of eggnog and 1/2 cup of milk. Heat over medium heat, stirring occasionally. Be careful not to let it boil as this can curdle the eggnog. Heat until it’s warm and steaming.

  • Step 3: Whisk for Froth

    Once heated, remove the saucepan from the heat. Using a whisk, vigorously whisk the mixture until it’s frothy. This will give your latte a nice texture. If you have a milk frother, feel free to use that instead.

  • Step 4: Combine Ingredients

    In a large mug, pour in the brewed espresso. Slowly add the warmed eggnog and milk mixture on top. Stir gently to combine.

  • Step 5: Add Nutmeg

    Sprinkle 1/4 teaspoon of ground nutmeg on top for a festive touch and additional flavor. Nutmeg adds a warm, spicy aroma that complements the eggnog.

  • Step 6: Optional Whipped Cream Topping

    If desired, top your Eggnog Latte with whipped cream for an indulgent finish. You can also add a sprinkle of nutmeg or cinnamon on top of the whipped cream for extra flavor.

Frequently Asked Questions

What is the best way to brew espresso or strong coffee if I don’t have an espresso machine?

You can use a stovetop Moka pot or a French press to brew strong coffee. Use a dark roast coffee for a richer flavor, and aim for a coffee-to-water ratio of about 1:15.

How do I heat eggnog and milk without curdling it?

Heat the eggnog and milk over medium-low heat and stir gently. Avoid boiling them, as high temperatures can cause curdling. Just warm them until steaming.

What can I substitute for espresso if I don’t have any?

You can substitute with strong brewed coffee or even a strong tea like chai, but the flavor will be different. Use a fine grind of coffee for a bolder taste.

Can I make this recipe dairy-free?

Yes! You can use almond milk, oat milk, or coconut milk in place of regular milk, and there are dairy-free eggnog options available as well.

What if I don’t have ground nutmeg?

You can substitute ground nutmeg with ground cinnamon or pumpkin spice for a different but still delightful flavor.

How do I make my whipped cream?

To make whipped cream, beat heavy cream with a mixer until it forms soft peaks. You can add sugar or vanilla extract for sweetness. Whipping by hand is also an option, just be prepared for a workout!

What is the best way to garnish my eggnog latte?

Sprinkle a little bit of ground nutmeg or cinnamon on top, or even add a drizzle of caramel or chocolate sauce for extra flair!

Is it safe to drink eggnog if I'm pregnant?

Traditional eggnog contains raw eggs, which can carry a risk of salmonella. Opt for pasteurized eggnog or make your own using pasteurized eggs to ensure safety.

What kitchen tools do I need to make an eggnog latte?

You'll need a coffee maker or espresso machine, a small saucepan for heating, a whisk or frother for frothing the milk and eggnog, and a large mug to serve.

How can I store leftover eggnog?

Store leftover eggnog in an airtight container in the fridge for up to a week. Shake well before using, as ingredients can separate.

Additional Information

Dietary Considerations

For dairy-free or vegan options, substitute regular milk with almond milk, oat milk, or any preferred plant-based milk. Use a dairy-free eggnog alternative available in stores or make your own using cashews or coconut milk blended with spices. For a lower sugar option, look for unsweetened versions of eggnog and consider using a natural sweetener like stevia. Ensure the espresso is made from a single-origin, organic coffee for a more sustainable choice.

Pairings

This Eggnog Latte pairs beautifully with spiced cookies, gingerbread men, or a slice of pumpkin pie. For a savory option, consider serving it alongside a cheese platter featuring aged gouda or brie. For beverages, enhance the experience with a festive red wine, such as a light pinot noir, or a spiced chai tea for those who prefer a non-caffeinated alternative.

Serving Suggestions

Serve the Eggnog Latte in a festive mug, garnished with a cinnamon stick for stirring and an extra sprinkle of nutmeg on top. Consider presenting it on a holiday-themed tray with a small plate of cookies or a dessert to create a cozy coffee shop experience at home. For an added touch, decorate the mug with a holiday ribbon or place it next to a small evergreen sprig for a seasonal feel.

Eggnog Latte

10 min
$3.5
300 kcal
Difficulty: 10%
Servings: 1

Allergens:

DairyEggs

Dietary Tags:

VegetarianContains Dairy

Cuisine:

AmericanHoliday

Course:

BeverageBreakfast

Tags:

BeverageHolidayCoffee

Description

A creamy, spiced latte infused with the rich flavor of eggnog, perfect for cozy mornings or festive gatherings.

Ingredients

  • eggnog: 1 cup
  • espresso or strong coffee: 1 shot
  • milk: 1/2 cup
  • ground nutmeg: 1/4 teaspoon
  • whipped cream (optional): as desired
